#Text=U.S. Senate approves revised bailout package after controversial additions
#Text=Saturday , October 4 , 2008

#Text=The U.S. Senate passed a revised bailout bill designed to help the struggling U.S. financial economy , which has measures nearly identical to the bill rejected by the U.S. House of Representatives on Monday .

#Text=" Senate Democrats and Republicans believe it is essential that we work quickly on this important legislation to restore confidence to our financial system and strengthen the economy , " said Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid .
#Text=The new revisions include raising the FDIC insurance cap to $ 250,000 , a move designed to please progressives .

#Text=However , the $ 110 billion in tax breaks , earmarks and what has been called pork barrel spending is not offset by any increases in revenues and has added opposition to the bill from some Representatives in the House .

#Text=Earmarks added into the bailout bill included $ 192 million in tax rebates for the Virgin Islands rum industry , $ 148 million in tax cuts for the wool industry , $ 100 million tax cuts to the auto racing industry , and $ 48 million in Hollywood tax incentives .
#Text=Vice President of Taxpayers for Common Sense , Steve Ellis , offered his explanation for the pork and earmarks added in .

#Text=" People who support some of these provisions will forget about the $ 700 billion and concerns they may have on that , and say , ' If you give me a few million in tax breaks for my constituents , I 'll go along ' " .
#Text=The tactic seems to have worked , however , managing to flip enough votes to pass the bill .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=The inclusion of parity , tax extenders and the FDIC increases has caused me to reconsider my position ,  said Representative Jim Ramstad ( R Minnesota ) , who voted against the previous bill on Monday .

column1: #Text=But Representative Marcy Kaptur ( D Ohio ) was not changing her no vote .
#Text=" I will not support this legislation because it 's the wrong medicine , " she said .
#Text=HAVE YOUR SAY
#Text=Do you think the bailout bill will help the US economy , hurt it , or be a waste of money ?
#Text=Add or view comments

#Text=The Senate took H.R.1424 , a bill originating in the House concerning " equity in the provision of mental health and substance-related disorder benefits under group health plans , to prohibit discrimination on the basis of genetic information with respect to health insurance and employment , " and extended it with the bailout provisions .

column1: #Text=H.R.1424 was introduced on March 9 , 2007 , by Rep. Patrick Kennedy ( RI-1 ) and had the support of First Lady Rosalind Carter .
#Text=It is noted on the Congressional Website that " On 10/1/2008 , the Senate passed H.R.1424 as the vehicle for the economic rescue legislation .

#Text=In the EAS version of the bill ( Engrossed Amendment as Agreed to by the Senate ) , Division A ( pp.1-110 ) is referred to as the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 ; Division B ( pp. 110-255 ) is referred to as the Energy Improvement and Extension Act of 2008 ; and Division C ( pp. 255-441 ) is referred to as the Tax Extenders and Alternative Minimum Tax Relief Act of 2008 .
